title: Black Walnut
description: Renowned for its deep brown tones and superior hardness and durability, Black Walnut is one of the most popular wood species in the furniture & woodworking world.

title: Spalted Maple
description: Spalted Maple is a lighter hardwood that, when aged and dried correctly, results in a beautiful, busy scene in the grain. Its figure makes it ideal as a focal point, with detailed movement in the grain lines.

title: American Elm
description: American Elm is a light, slightly less dense hardwood that often shows long contours in its grain, accompanied with very open grain pores.

title: Siberian Elm
description: Siberian Elm is lighter hardwood like its American cousin, but often is found with small patches of burled grains all throughout the wood.

title: Sycamore
description: Sycamore wood has varying caramel and tan tones that tend to blend in harmony throughout the piece. A unique, feather-like pattern is often seen in the grain.

title: Ash
description: Ash is a very light wood that tends to be on the soft side. It's ideal for projects that require a light-colored wood finish.

title: Claro Walnut
description: Claro Walnut is a variety of Black Walnut that comes from northern California. Because of growing conditions, the wood boasts extraordinary figure and burling and ideal grain tones.

title: Custom Wood
description: If you don't see the wood you like, let us know what you have in mind for your project and we will quote the wood cost for you in addition to the project.

title: Cookie Exclusive Wood
description: Special wood option available exclusively for Cookie designs. If you don't see the wood you like, let us know what you have in mind for your project and we will quote the wood cost for you in addition to the project.
